intro: Verbascum ebubekirceylanii, commonly known as the Ebubekirceylan mullein, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which includes several species of flowering plants known for their fuzzy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in clusters at the ends of stems. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological characteristics.
